class_notes: (This is a course about the biology of behavior. Special attention is given to sex, eating, drinking, sleeping and waking. Other topics include: the influence of drugs on behavior, recovery of function after brain damage, and the neural and chemical substrates of pain and pleasure. A good entry course for students interested in physiological psychology/behavioral neuroscience. Two midterm exams with an optional comprehensive exam.)
course_description: The neurobiology of sexual desire, hunger, thirst, arousal, drug addiction, and sleeping and waking.
schedule_location: MWF 10am-10:50am in New Psyc Bldg 290 (36 Eagle Ro
